results.title: A Visual heritage
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Traces the highlights of the history of photography. Includes the pioneering work of Louis Daguerre and Nicephore Niepce which enabled the world to see itself objectively for the first time. This program features a number of historical photographs and a discussion of early photography by experts in the field.

results.title: A Visual dictionary
results.creator_credit: Sheldon Renan, David Adams and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Film Terms”.
Illustrates basic filmmaking language as it is used in the writing, shooting, and editing of a motion picture. Defines and demonstrates script terminology, kinds of shots, lenses and their effects, camera angles and movement, sound, and optical effects. Suitable for upper secondary and tertiary/teacher levels.

results.title: A Visit to puppets
results.brief_description: The Baj Teatr, Warsaw, is one of nineteen Polish puppet theatres for children. Everything at the Baj has a professional appearance - the finely constructed puppets, sets, beautiful costumes - all made by the theatre’s staff of artists and actors. A short play is presented, using puppets seen in construction earlier in the film. Commentary spoken by Lucie Gray.

results.title: A Visit to Ireland
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The film shows various aspects of life in Southern Ireland. Covers the following: typical farm activities, harvesting grain, thatching with straw, peat cutting; scenes of Blarney Castle and of the Blarney Stone; life in Dublin; carding, spinning and weaving in the home; the churches of Ireland; recreational activities.

results.title: A Visit from St Nicholas: a Coronet fantasy
results.creator_credit: David A. Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: Animated adaptation of “Twas the night before Christmas” by Clement Clarke Moore executed in a simple limited animation style including 3-D objects and cut-out animation techniques.

results.title: A Visit from space
results.brief_description: Animated film about the adventures of a little girl who meets an inhabitant of a distant planet. It is based on the new world of space as seen through the fantasy of a modern child.

results.title: A Versatile Navy
results.brief_description: A catalogue of the ships belonging to the Royal Australian Navy. The film illustrates the advanced modern equipment with which the ships are fitted, and explains their roles in guarding the shoreline of our country.

results.title: A Venezia
results.brief_description: Covers cultural activities during the World Week for Venice, organised by UNESCO. Appearances by Peter Ustinov, Spanish flamenco dancers Jose and Ricardo, Ravi Shankar, Paul McCartney and Wings, Georges Moustaki and many other performers are interspersed with scenes of Venice.

results.title: A Typical garden spider
results.brief_description: Presents a study of the life cycle of the cross spider showing how the spider builds its web, how it traps food in the web, how the female protects her eggs, and how the young spiders hatch and emerge from cocoons. Includes scenes of a spider trapping a fly in the web, stinging it to paralyse it, and encasing it in a cocoon of silk.
